scenarios.title: check procedures

steps.value: When I execute HTTP ((GET)) request for resource with relative URL `/masterdata/api/v1/procedures`
When I save JSON element from `#{loadResource(/files/procedures_specialties.json)}` by JSON path `$..procedure` to ((scenario)) variable `procedures`
Then JSON element from `${response}` by JSON path `$.*.name` is equal to `${procedures}`IGNORING_ARRAY_ORDER

When I find ((>)) `0` JSON elements from `${response}` by `$.*` and for each element do
|step                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|When I save JSON element value from `${json-context}` by JSON path `$.name` to scenario variable `procedure-name`                                                                                      |
|When I save JSON element from `#{loadResource(/files/procedures_specialties.json)}` by JSON path `$.[?(@.procedure == "${procedure-name}")].specialties.*` to scenario variable `procedure-specialties`|
|Then JSON element from `${json-context}` by JSON path `$.specialties..name` is equal to `${procedure-specialties}`IGNORING_ARRAY_ORDER                                                                 |

steps.value: When I execute HTTP ((GET)) request for resource with relative URL `/masterdata/api/v1/specialties`
When I save JSON element from `#{loadResource(/files/procedures_specialties.json)}` by JSON path `$..specialties[?(@ != '')]` to ((scenario)) variable `specialties`
Given I initialize ((scenario)) variable `specialties` with value `#{evalGroovy(return specialties.replace('[', '').replace(']', '').split(',').toList().unique())}`
Then JSON element from `${response}` by JSON path `$..name` is equal to `${specialties}`IGNORING_ARRAY_ORDER
